sub_title: Senior Experience Lead Sustainability at Philips
summary:
I am deeply passionate about sustainability (i.e. social innovation, urban transitions, sustainable systemic change, circularity) and driven to support organisations in public and private sectors to transform, innovate and grow in a durable manner. I address societal problems by identifying and making sense of emerging signals of change in sustainability that will result in new business opportunities. Purposely to transform towards a more resilient society. 

While exposed to the creative process, I shine in sustainable innovation and experience strategy. Driving insights and future directions that support the creation of meaningful and innovative solutions. Translating abstract strategies into tangible experiences and actionable tools for design and development. I do this by leveraging:
•	Design research and analysis
•	Domain knowledge 
•	Commercial innovation and (radical) innovation triggering 
•	Consultancy on process and content
•	Facilitation of design thinking sessions and co-creation process

I am able to work on a broad variety of projects across many industries, and have been exposed to the fashion, food, and currently the healthcare industry. At the moment, I work as strategic design consultant for Royal Philips The Netherlands at the Design Experience department (Group Innovation & Strategy).

awards.title: Social AdVenture Challenge Audience Award 2014
awards.description: With Cordaid Social AdVenture, both Cordaid and Enviu tempt to support initiatives, undertaking action in a financially independent way. The Alternative Diaper project, that enhances an ecosystem for bio-degradable diapers, won both the Social AdVenture Challenge Audience Award and the Social AdVenture Challenge Award including € 10.000 to develop the business idea.

awards.title: Outstanding Women in Technology 2014
awards.description:
Femme Tech Magazine is an annual publication for technical and professional women in the Netherlands.
Within the section "Outstanding Women in Technology", the magazine shows that women whom choose the field of technology are not ordinary types.  Aylin Groenewoud was chosen as one of the four most outstanding women in technology 2014 and explains how challenging and versatile the field of technology can be.

awards.title: HOT100 Award 2013
awards.description: HOT100 is an annual talent program which honours the 100 most talented and promising design, media and art alumni in The Netherlands. HOT100 aims to bring a new generation of talented designers, thinkers and makers from all over the country into contact with (creative) companies and cultural organisations.

awards.title: Innovation and Development Award 2011
awards.description: The Innovation and Science Award honors the 3 most innovative projects in under development countries.

contributors.headline: Senior Experience Lead Sustainability at Philips

projects.title: Alternative Diaper (Social Innovation Project)
projects.description:
BRIEF: The Dutch foundation Niketan supports a Bangladeshi initiative to take care of mentally disabled children. This design project faced the problem that these children are not toilet trained, while introducing Western diapers is impossible since these are too expensive and there is no disposal system available.

RESULT: Dayapara; an environmentally, user, and helper friendly alternative for the Western diaper.

HONORS/PUBLICATIONS: Innovation & Development Award 2011, Eindhovens Dagblad, Business Nieuws Radio, Radio Netherlands Worldwide, Haagse Courant, Algemeen Dagblad, TU Delta

Bachelor Project for Niketan / 5 months / The Netherlands & Bangladesh

contributors.headline: Senior Experience Lead Sustainability at Philips

projects.title: Control-Panel (UI update)
projects.description:
BRIEF: Remake of the UI of a cyber security company based in Eindhoven (The Netherlands) that develops cutting-edge network monitoring, intelligence, and protection technology to make its customers more securing and in control. The company was founded in 2009 and operates in a number of control industries such as oil & gas, power generation, energy distribution and so on. 

RESULT: This project concerns the flagship product that has been used in production since 2011. Meaningwise and AG, both part of the Mana collective, are responsible for the UI update and a potentially UX update in the longer run.

CONTRIBUTION:
- Design Research
- UX & UI design

contributors.headline: Senior Experience Lead Sustainability at Philips
Digital Product Design & Research | Hands-on Innovation Consulting | Freelance

projects.title: Transport Management System Trucking (UX design)
projects.description:
BRIEF: Trucking.nl is an online platform that is part of Logistic Force Group (an innovative HR service for the Transport and Logistics sector).
Trucking.nl is designed for transporters and charters with the intention to give direction to the growing need for transparency, flexibility and fair cooperation. In fact, transporters are provided with an insight into the quickly available (flexible) capacity on the charter market. 

RESULT: For this project, Meaningwise, Socionova, and AG are responsible for the UI design related activities of the platform. Including an analysis of the current website, website architecture design, interface design, and styling of the visual identity. 

CONTRIBUTION:
- Design Research
- Workshop Facilitation
- Service Design
- UX & UI design

contributors.headline: Senior Experience Lead Sustainability at Philips
Service Design Lead bij ANWB Energie
Digital Product Design & Research | Hands-on Innovation Consulting | Freelance

projects.title: Freightlive (Design Research)
projects.description:
BRIEF: Freightlive focuses on the promotion and improvement of cooperation between logistic carriers and their clients via cloud (software) solutions. 
For Freightlive Meaningwise, NacorMartina, Jeroen van der Meij and AG, used state of the art design research methods to develop eight persona posters. Personas are archetypes that are built after a thorough observation of the target audience. Personas provide accurate insights into the relative value and desires of the audience. Due to, support business strategy and innovation and are especially interesting for developing a valuable customer-focused strategy. 
Personas come in all shapes and sizes but standard forms show to be static graphs.

RESULT
Eight persona posters, related to the archetype of the driver, planner, administrator, expeditor, client, planner-admin, and planner-driver archetypes, were developed. Each one can be updated on any occasion and support dynamic direct interaction within the Freightlive’s internal teams. Due to, support customer-focused communication within meetings and can tie ideas and concepts at any time back to the company and the real market.

CONTRIBUTION:
- Design Research

contributors.headline: Senior Experience Lead Sustainability at Philips

projects.title: Green Beach Castricum (Strategic Design Research)
projects.description:
BRIEF: Castricum aan Zee is a Dutch beach resort that is especially known for its tranquility, space and nature. In 2020, Castricum aan Zee aims to be most sustainable beach of Europe. This means Castricum is challenged to implement changes related to their touristic facilities and environment on a diversity of aspects (e.g. leisure, foods, mobility). In cooperation with J. Tielman as experience management expert, and R. John as project manager Aylin Groenewoud worked as a design consultant and advisor to Castricum aan Zee’s beach bars, restaurants, and related organizations in this process. 

CURRENT RESULTS: Design research & Ideation: AG used observations and contextual interviews in order to analyze customer experiences and interactions. This has provided insight in understanding how the customers experience the current services. Due to the work of the aforementioned team, opportunities for improvement and innovation based on sustainable intentions were revealed and taken up for implementation.

CONTRIBUTION:
- Design Research
- Service Design
- Strategic Design

contributors.headline: Senior Experience Lead Sustainability at Philips
CS Ops • Customer Success • Customer Experience • Data Analytics for CS

projects.title: Openness to the Otherness of the Other (Strategic Design Project)
projects.description:
BRIEF: Openness to the Otherness of the Other is contextualized in and elaborated for the Dutch fashion label named Inti Knitwear. Inti Knitwear produces garments in Ecuador for countries in the West and East Asia. The developed Meet Your Knitter app creates the opportunity to scan the fashion item’s label and experience the process, people and story of a garment. If Inti Knitwear's customers use the same app to send in a picture where they show the knitters how they like to wear a purchased garment, they can win a custom-made garment for which they can select their favourite knitter and sewer. Producers take the send in picture as source of inspiration.

RESULT: Meet Your Knitter App; helps customers and producers connect with each other,and engage in a meaningful dialogue about their environment - and the fashion items that surround them. Together create items that resonate with the individual customers style. 

HONORS: HOT100 2013 Award

Final Master Project for Inti Knitwear / 10 months / The Netherlands & Ecuador

contributors.headline: Senior Experience Lead Sustainability at Philips

projects.title: Food, Technology, Design (Strategic Design Project)
projects.description:
BRIEF: Nowadays, researchers at Biomedical department of the University of Technology Eindhoven are working on a new type of meat called in-vitro meat. In-vitro meat is laboratory-grown meat developed from animal tissue. The project’s goal concerned projecting this research on future developments resulting in new (industrial) food concepts, products, services.

RESULT: La Pâte; cultured meat that is presented as a high-end food experience. 

HONORS/PUBLICATIONS: Part of Designhuis Eindhoven – Exhibition Etende Mens(2013), and Mart
Milano - Exhibition The Shape of Taste(2013)

First years Master Project for BMT TU/e and Prof. Dr. C. van der Weele / 5 months / The Netherlands

authors.headline: Senior Experience Lead Sustainability at Philips

profile_positions.title: Senior Experience Lead - Government & Public Affairs

profile_positions.description:
Contribute to the realisation of Philips’ ambitious environmental responsibility, social and corporate governance (ESG) targets, by developing the business of Sustainability Healthcare Consulting program in Philips Experience Design.

• Leading and overseeing the development of the Sustainability Healthcare Consulting proposition from concept to launch cross business in collaboration with engineers, service marketeers, designers, consultants, etc.
• Leading the execution of Sustainability Healthcare Consulting projects commercially with our healthcare customers across Europe, UK-I, and the USA. 
• Establishing and managing partnerships with 3rd parties that contribute to the commercialisation of the Sustainability Healthcare Consulting proposition or contribute to the Philips ESG goals
• Being a partner towards Philips Group Sustainability in driving commercial sales in ESG
• Official international spokesperson for Philips and sustainability
profile_positions.title: Senior Experience Lead - Sustainability Healthcare Consulting

profile_positions.description:
Contribute to the realisation of Philips’ ambitious environmental responsibility, social and corporate governance (ESG) targets, by driving the Circular Design program in Philips Experience Design. 

•	Lead the creative direction on program level and build & drive the circular design strategy
•	Scope, setup and run multi-disciplinary circular economy projects internally and externally (e.g., circular design enablers (methodologies & tools), training, metrics & KPIs, propositions)
•	Provide circular design thought leadership to senior business leaders, healthcare customers and governments. 
•	Be a partner towards Philips Group Sustainability in driving the market & customer ESG targets incl. strategy alignment.
profile_positions.title: Experience Lead - Circular Design & Innovation

profile_positions.description:
Support strategic collaborations with partners and customers around the world - such as government health organizations, private industry innovation centers and educational institutions - in sustainable systemic change. 

•	Develop the innovation strategy and support models for local account teams
•	Engage with account teams to open a dialogue on opportunities with customers
•	Run business to government innovation led projects and programs
•	Consolidate learnings and tools across global markets and functions
•	Bring local market insights into the design research program funnel and program development
profile_positions.title: Strategic Design Consultant

profile_positions.description:
As freelance Design & Innovation professional, AG, I was part of the dutch design collective called Mana.  Mana is a multi-disciplinary network consulting in service and experience design. 

The Accomplishment profile section shows the various (service and strategic design) projects that were developed.
profile_positions.title: Freelance Design & Innovation Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Next Nature Network is the international network for anyone interested to join the debate on our future – in which nature and technology are fusing. As a innovation debater and educator, I supported  these debates in two of Next Nature's core projects, namely the Nano Supermarket project, and Bistro In Vitro project. 
At platforms like fairs, summits, and festivals (e.g. Dutch Design Week, TEDX Brainport, Lowlands, District conference Rotary etc.) debate provoking products that are both innovative as well as uncanny and disturbing  which might hit the shelves in 10 years were presented. Purposely to develop scenarios for potential technological futures, helping us to decide what future we actually want.
profile_positions.title: Innovation Debator & Educator

profile_positions.description:
Over the last era industries spread diversely, resulting in a more fragmented world. Labourers are no longer in contact with the end product, and customers are excluded from the processes of production. One might say that humans have been alienated from their products’ true destination and origin.

In collaboration with the fashion label Inti Knitwear I made Inti Knitwear’s process and systems that surround their customers and producers intelligible and knowable. Supporting customers and producers to connect with each other and engage in a meaningful dialogue through the designed ‘Meet Your Knitter / Customer’ app and connected products. Developing services for embodied contact and customization of products. By this, illustrating a potential way to address the global production system and connected material culture.   

Please review the Openness to the Otherness of the Other project in the Accomplishment section for more information.
profile_positions.title: Strategic Design & Innovation Intern

profile_positions.description:
This 6 months Bachelor Industrial Design internship at the NGO Niketan focused on improving the hygiene and the quality of life of disabled children and young adults in Bangladesh.
Roos van der Schoor and myself developed an innovative bio-degradable diaper, providing the extremely vulnerable with a more human, more dignified existence.

Please review the Openness to the Otherness of the Other project in the Accomplishment section for more information.
profile_positions.title: Social Innovation Intern
